title: X Factor's Try Star forced to remove stripper poles from 'raunchiest ever' routine
text:

X Factor: Celebrity 's Try Star have been forced to cool down their steamy routine for tonight's show amid fears it will spark complaints for being too steamy.

Rugby hunks Thom Evans, Ben Foden and Levi Davis are due to perform a Magic Mike style number to a medley of Genuwine's Pony and Lil Nas X's Old Town Road.

Tonight is the first live show of the singing competition, which will also feature Vinnie Jones, Megan McKenna and a band of former Love Island stars.

Try Star had intended to dance around stripper poles, but after a rehearsal that reportedly left the production crew blushing, they've had to tone it down a bit and producers have banned the poles.

(Image: ITV)

A source told The Sun that the sportsmen are hoping to win over the audience due to their sex appeal and they are even concerned they will receive the same kind of complaints made about Amanda Holden's revealing dresses.

They said: "They are all hoping to impress Nicole Scherzinger , who has a front row seat to what is set to be the raunchiest performance the X Factor stage has ever seen!

"But producers have told the boys that the dance poles they wanted to use are one step too far and they’ve been removed from the creative.

(Image: ITV)

"They've drawn the line at poles but the lads are still set on getting all the ladies and men hot under the collar as they take to the stage on Saturday night."

The source revealed that during the raunchy rehearsal with the stripper poles, the production staff didn't know where to look.

But the poles being removed doesn't mean Try Star won't be turning up the heat.

(Image: ITV)

"There’s still some worry that the lads may leave viewers shocked by their hip action antics as they fight to get through to next week's show."

But they added that this doesn't mean the band isn't taking the process seriously.

Meanwhile Kevin McHale has been suffering from a sinus infection ahead of his performance and has resorted to using a vocal steamer to try to get his voice ready for tonight.

(Image: Instagram)

Kevin, 31, underwent sinus surgery earlier this year following a long term problem, and this show is the first time he is singing live since then.

He posted a photo on Instagram showing him steaming his throat, with the caption: "1 night to go, steam. the X Factor."

The show's producers are reportedly worried about what to do if he cannot sing live tonight.
description: Try Star's rugby hunks have been told their routine is too raunchy for X Factor: Celebrity
